New Records: The Braves increased their MLB-best division title total to 23.
The Braves hit a NL record 282 home runs and are on pace for 312, which is five more than the AL/NL record.
Austin Riley, Matt Olson, and Ronald Acuña Jr. each hit 35-plus homers, with Olson hitting 51 and Acuña hitting 37.
Ozzie Albies is one homer away from making the Braves just the second team to ever have five players hit 30-plus homers in the same season, joining the 2019 Twins.
Key Match Events: Austin Riley hit a two-run homer in the first inning and added a third-inning sacrifice fly.
Spencer Strider allowed just one run over seven innings.
Kirby Yates recorded the final out of the night, leading to the Braves' celebration of their division title.
Post-Match Reflections: Braves manager Brian Snitker emphasized the importance of enjoying the moment and recognizing the hard work that led to the victory.
Ronald Acuña Jr. stated, 'The job is not done.'
Austin Riley highlighted the team's belief in each other and the fun they have coming to the park every day.
Max Fried reflected on the team's ability to overcome injuries and enjoy their success.
Spencer Strider discussed the team's commitment to winning the NL East and how it influenced their preparation and focus.
A.J. Minter expressed that winning the division title is an expectation when wearing an Atlanta Braves jersey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves have gone 63-26 dating back to June 3.
The Braves ended the race with a 17-game lead over the Phillies.
The Braves were in first place at the end of every one of their games, minus April 2.
The Braves are four wins away from a second straight 100-win season.
